header

Class EIAHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • header.EIA

  • public class EIAHeader
extends EIA
    EIA header file in format of HashTable

      • EIAHeader

        public EIAHeader()
        Default constructor with the file name entry

      • EIAHeader

        public EIAHeader(java.io.RandomAccessFile raf,
                 java.io.File edfFile)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Construct an EIA header from a file. With this constructor, the readFromDisk() is obsolete.
        Parameters:
        raf - the file to be read
        edfFile - the host file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException

      • EIAHeader

        public EIAHeader(EIATable table,
                 int rowIndex)
        Builds EIA header from a row in EIA table Format is either XML or EIA
        Parameters:
        table - EIATable used to extract attribute
        rowIndex - the row index to extract attribute

      • EIAHeader

        public EIAHeader(EIATable table)
        Builds EIA header from an EIATable in the first row Same as calling EIAHeader(table, 0);
        Parameters:
        table - the EIATable from which to build an EIA header

      • EIAHeader

        public EIAHeader(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> header)
        Evaluate an ESA header directly from another header
        Parameters:
        header - EIA header to be copied

      • writeEiaHeader

        public void writeEiaHeader(java.io.RandomAccessFile raf)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Regularizes the string format of attribute values to bytes, and writes attribute byte[] value to the file one by one. Note: this might be problematic
        Parameters:
        raf - random file accessor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException

      • saveToDisk

        public void saveToDisk(java.io.RandomAccessFile raf,
                       java.io.File file)
        Saves the current EIA header to file.
        Parameters:
        raf - random file accessor to write data to file
        file - the file to store the header. the file must conform to raf
